item.title: Two Point Museum DLC ‘Zooseum’ launches December 2 for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC, in 2026 for Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

"Free Taster Content" now available.

Two Point Museum downloadable content “Zooseum” will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC on December 2, followed by Switch 2 in 2026, publisher SEGA and developer Two Point Studios announced.

The “Free Taster Content,” which offers a free taste of the upcoming content in “Zooseum,” is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via a free update. This content will be available for Switch 2 later in 2025.

Here are the latest details:

“Free Taster Content”

For those eager to dip their toes into the animal kingdom early, the “Free Taster Content” is available now for Steam, Epic Games, Xbox and PlayStation, offering a sneak peak of the Zooseum before the full downloadable content arrives next month.

The “Free Taster Content” allows players a preview of a select range of areas from the new expansion including, the brand-new museum location, Silverbottom Park, the first star of the Zooseum campaign, access to a new Wildlife Expert, Wildlife-themed decorations and a selection of Zooseum-themed plushies, books, onesies, and even posters for the Gift Shop!

“Zooseum”

In Two Point Museum downloadable content “Zooseum,” players will rescue, raise, and rehabilitate a menagerie of marvellous misfits from a Spyglass Giraffe to a Cabin Snail—nursing them back to health before releasing them into the wild. Design immersive natural habitats, create fascinating creature-inspired exhibits, and bring the untamed beauty (and occasional smell) of nature into the heart of Two Point County. Whether you’re caring for cuddly critters or something with considerably sharper teeth, you’ll need compassion, creativity, and a good stockpile of cleaning supplies.

What’s included in the downloadable content:

  • A brand-new museum location in the beautiful Silverbottom Park
  • New expert type: Wildlife Experts
  • A new expedition map: Farflung Isles
  • Over 40 Wildlife Exhibits including habitat animals and terrarium animals
  • A fresh five-star campaign to complete
  • New adorable gift shop items
  • Three new interactive displays
  • New themed items and decorations
  • Two new animal-focused rooms: Habitat Enclosure and Wildlife Welfare

With new facilities, theming options, and fresh gameplay twists, Zooseum transforms your museum into a thriving hub for animal lovers, conservationists, and anyone who’s ever dreamed of giving a Zebra a second chance at life!

Early adopters of “Zooseum” can enjoy a 10 percent-off discount* during the first week of launch.

* The discount is available on Steam, Epic Games, Xbox, and PlayStation. (PlayStation discount available to PlayStation Plus subscribers only.)
* The “Free Taster Content” will become available to Nintendo Switch 2 later this year.

Two Point Museum is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/two-point-museum-dlc-zooseum-launches-december-2-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-pc-in-2026-for-switch-2

item.title: There Are No Ghosts at the Grand demo now available for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Try out the horror musical mystery game.

A demo for horror musical mystery game There Are No Ghosts at the Grand is now available for PC via Steam, developer Friday Sundae announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Friday Sundae:

In There are No Ghosts at the Grand, players will inherit a crumbling English hotel and restore it by day, while battling ghosts by night. With a sardonic cat, a talking power tool, and a twisting supernatural plot, in a unique musical mystery narrative adventure.

From spooky ska to wartime jazz to skater punk, each mysterious character you meet has their own story and song, waiting to be uncovered.

But when night falls, your talking power tools transform into weapons against the supernatural. Unleash the vacuum on vengeful spirits, expose invisible assailants with the paint sprayer, or subdue slithering spooks with a well-aimed bookcase to the face using the furniture cannon.

As players explore, renovate, and restore, they’ll uncover Lovecraftian mysteries, and with each passing day, a creeping horror tightens its grip.

There Are No Ghosts at the Grand is due out for Xbox Series and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store in 2026, with ‘additional platforms to be announced later.’ It will also be available via Game Pass.

Watch a new trailer below.

Demo Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/there-are-no-ghosts-at-the-grand-demo-now-available-for-pc

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II ‘Reclamation’ update now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

New operation, hero weapons, stratagems, and rewards.

Publisher Focus Entertainment and developer Saber Interactive have released the “Reclamation” update for third-person action game Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II, the companies announced.

The update adds the new Operation “Reclamation,” new hero weapons “Bolt Sniper Rifle,” “Heavy Bolter,” “Instigator Bolt Carbine,” “Heavy Bolt Pistol,” “Power Fist,” and “Thunder Hammer,” and new stratagems and rewards. For Season Pass II owners, the “Blood Angels Champion Pack” and “Salamanders Cosmetic Pack” are also available.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch a new trailer below.

“Reclamation” Update Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/warhammer-40000-space-marine-ii-reclamation-update-now-available

item.title: LumenTale: Memories of Trey delayed to spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Explore the region of Talea in new trailer.

Publisher Team17 and developer Beehive Studios have delayed monster collector RPG LumenTale: Memories of Trey from its previously planned 2025 release window to spring 2026. It will be available for Switch and PC via Steam.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Embark on an unforgettable adventure with LumenTale: Memories of Trey, a captivating monster collector RPG set in a beautiful and enchanting world.

Discover an emotional tale of self-discovery, adventure through captivating regions each as unique as their people. Join Trey as he navigates his way through a land full of mystical creatures to reveal the mystery behind his lost memories.

Story

Long ago, in the golden era of Talea, the Emperor kept the lands peaceful, and the people prospered. After passing away without naming a successor between his twin sons, a civil war raged between the North, Logos and the South, Mythos – fighting for who would take control of the throne. The townsfolk lived in fear from the atrocities being carried out in the conflict. In a bid to stop the destruction, a part of the empire’s military became Talea’s dedicated protectors.

From the everlasting darkness of war, these people were the beacon of light that brought people hope. The Lumen were born, and as guardians in their provinces, they ensure the safety of the residents of Talea, both the people and the Animon.

Since ancient times, people have long studied the Animon. Not much is known of their nature to this day. They’re made of Anivis, an energy that flows through the whole world, and they possess the ability to affect emotions and interact with the very soul of every living being. Catch the Animon and become inseparable partners as you harness their elemental powers and battle alongside each other with your Holoken.

Key Features

  • Catching Animon – Test your skills with the Holoken and catch Animon in the field to recruit them to your party or initiate an incredible and exciting battle against them to prove your mettle! Every Animon can perform their own abilities and skills, and victory is achieved through using the best strategy with your team. There are around 140 known species with 13 elemental types, which are categorized with attributes depending on the emotion they’re able to evoke in people.
  • Battles – Engage in thrilling 1v1 duels or team up for epic four-versus-four showdowns with your party in battle. Level up your Animons and outsmart your opponents by using the best strategy to win. Each Animon has strengths and weaknesses for you to uncover, so use them to your advantage.
  • Trading – With up to three different ways to trade your Animon, you can effortlessly complete your collection and build the perfect battle team. Connect to the Animon Trade Station to seek the Animon you need, trade directly with friends, or the community.
  • Cook and Craft – While on your adventure, be sure to take a rest at the Fountain, where you’ll be able to craft useful items and cook delicious food! If you’re feeling adventurous, you’ll be able to experiment with ingredients to help nurture your Animon.
  • The Anispace – The Anispace is a place that exists and doesn’t exist at the same time. A space detached from the world as we know it. Here is where you’ll find your Animon after you capture them and where you’ll be able to train your Animon for battle. Customize their space when they’re not in your battle party and create stronger bonds with them!

Watch a new trailer below.

Explore the Region of Talea



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/lumentale-memories-of-trey-delayed-to-spring-2026
